files.title: 2019-06-IBNBDv4
files.details:
Linux kernel v5.2-rc3

null_blk exported devices from server to client.

IBNBD and NVMEoF are configured with the default parameters.

In the Multiple Disks setting a single separate fio process is accessingeach device, while the number of devices is varied.

In the Multiple Jobs setting a single device is mapped, while number of fio jobs accessing that device is varied.

For Dual Path measurement two different policies have been tested: - IBNBD - round robin and min-inflight (choose path with minimum inflights) - NVMEoF - round robin and numa (set over iopolicy)

FIO Configuration: [global] bssplit=512/20:1k/16:2k/9:4k/12:8k/19:16k/10:32k/8:64k/4 fadvise_hint=0 rw=randrw:2 direct=1 random_distribution=zipf:1.2 time_based=1 runtime=30 ramp_time=10 ioengine=libaio iodepth=128 iodepth_batch_submit=128 iodepth_batch_complete=128 numjobs=1 group_reporting cpus_allowed_policy=split numa_mem_policy=local

dictionary.40 CPUs Intel(R) Xeon(R) Silver 4114:
40 CPUs Intel(R) Xeon(R) Silver 4114 CPU @ 2.20GHz
Mellanox Technologies MT27700 Family
[ConnectX-4] 100GBs
